Topic.Title: Sidwell Friends School sounds like a very safe place for children

Message.Msg: ... “As far as the quote ‘In your heart’…I believe most conservatives know the quote” - froggie Of course they do, gremlin. As do all the liberals, centrists, Democrats, moderate Republicans and otherwise sane people from 1964, who recognized the campaign slogan of Barry Goldwater for what it was… “…his slogan ‘In your heart, you know he's right’ was successfully parodied by the Johnson campaign into ‘In your guts, you know he's nuts’, or ‘In your heart, you know he might’ (as in push the nuclear button), or even ‘In your heart, he's too far right’…” I find it fascinating (but not at all surprising) that you’re here promoting an election slogan from a guy who opposed the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The slogan you admire so much, helped contribute to his losing the biggest landslide in the popular vote history, with a lopsided victory for Johnson by over 61% to Goldwater’s 38%. The man you apparently admire so much, carried only his home state of Arizona (barely), and the five Dixie states of SC, GA, AL, MS and LA, mainly because those states in ’64 were still largely an all-white electorate, united against civil rights…not at all unlike the very small contingency of racist, intolerant remnants of that movement – The Tea Party – who you represent today. It is mind boggling that you folks have apparently learned nothing at all from that era, yet continue longing for a bygone political atmosphere equivalent to the “good ol’ boys’ club.” Worse yet, you also apparently learned nothing from the recent election that repudiated your extremist views. Even Goldwater, mellowed in his old age, acknowledged that his party had strayed way too far to the right by saying, “Do not associate my name with anything you do. You are extremists, and you've hurt the Republican Party much more than the Democrats have.” That’s even more applicable today, but somehow the powers that you represent refuse to permit you shills to speak the truth. Instead, you keep heading down that path of extinction, not unlike the many endangered frog species of the world…although in your case, froggie, it’s suicide by politics. RIBBIT!

Topic.Title: Sidwell Friends School sounds like a very safe place for children

Message.Msg: You choose a line from "Politics and the English Language" to describe me? You'd do better to read that essay than to select quotes from internet searches. Immediately following that sentences is his criticism of "worn-out and useless phrases"--the very grist of conservative writing these days. Look at Froggie's post. It is little more than a litany of conservative buzzwords that would make Orwell cringe. Orwell's thesis is that imprecise and poor language skills lead to imprecise and poor thinking. People who do not speak clearly become victims of the political language Orwell described. In other words, they fail to recognize #$%$. You should not look to me for that. You should look to Jon, robfisk, winholder and Froggie. You should demand precision and clarity in language and shun those who cannot or will not provide it.

Message.Msg: "I was attempting to point out the intellecual dishonesty of those on the left (Mr. Gregory) who spent 30 minutes on his TV show (Meet The Press) attempting to discredit conservatives for having the temerity to desire the same level of security enjoyed by Mr. Gregory's children and the children of our "dear leader"." Hilarious. Do these same conservatives have the temerity to desire the same level of *education* enjoyed by Mr. Gregory's children and the children of our "dear leader"? Nope. It never occurred to you that "Equalizer" and "Peacemaker" were ironic names for guns, not descriptive names. It is not guns that make people equal. It is education. Again, I question the sanity of people who make equal access to guns into a noble cause, but who believe the Department of Education is "socialism". "I believe most conservatives know the quote" A source for the quote does not make your post any more comprehensible.

It turns out I was right. The last thing we need is more "good guys" like Zimmerman, armed with AR-15s, roaming the streets.

Message.Msg: Well golly gee Ricky, I must have hit a nerve, and for that I will appologize, but as far as the Civil Rights act of 1964 is concerned most Republicans (that I know) are proud of the members of their party and the votes that they made during that time, because were it not for Republican votes in the Senate and the leadership of Senator Everett Mckinley Dirksen (a Republican from the state of Illinois) the filibuster by democrats would never have been broken. A couple of facts that may have slipped by you: o 71 senators voted to invoke cloture o 67 votes were needed o 44 democrats and 27 Republicans joined together to bring the bill to a final vote o Of those voting "nay" 80% were democrats including Robert C. Byrd and former vice president Al Gore's father I realize that race baiting is one of the favored tactics used by the folks on your side, and I know that for the most part the left and their willing partners in the main stream media get away with providing their version of the truth, but I am sorry Ricky you are not entitled to your version of the facts. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

You fit perfectly into that realm, because you fail to recognize the #$%$! Old George is one of your hero's, but at the same time statements like the one above if submitted by anyone else, you would have branded that person as a racist. I think I have been very clear in my use of the language; you just disagree with the words and the concepts and pretend that anyone that is disagreeable with your standards and beliefs is a fool. Not so! Throughout history, liberalism has lead to the downfall of many empires and great civilizations as it will the United States and democracy if we continue present trends. Our current leader is a narcissist that thinks he was sent to save the world, not just the U.S. while not having the leadership skills to run a mid-sized company, let alone a nation. His desire is to fundamentally change this country if we want it or not because he has a vision of 'fairness' that is incompatible with reality. You need to get over yourself and look around. Try considering the other points of view before condemning them to the scrap heap of liberalism's hatred. You’re a living, breathing hypocrite.

Message.Title: AT&T Chart looks ominous
Message.Msg: About a week ago the 50 DMA crossed below the 200 DMA and T has been dropping ever since. Now T is trading below the lower Bollinger Band which is at $33.48. At $33.33, only 15 cents under the band, it is not yet a panic and volume is below average so don't rush out and sell. However a stop loss at $32.96 might be a good idea. Bollinger theory holds that, when the bands get close together, a breakout up or down is indicated. Often the initial breakout is swiftly reversed and a breakout occurs in the opposite direction. My point is, AT&T should be watched very closely for the rest of the year. A month ago I predicted a flat December and that has certainly occurred. I also predicted a jump to $40 starting in February. It now looks as if that might start in January. http://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=T#symbol=t;range=1y;compare=;indicator=dividend+bollinger+sma%28200%29+ema+volume+stochasticslow+rsi;charttype=candlestick;crosshair=on;ohlcvalues=1;logscale=off;source=undefined;

I question the sensibilities of people who discuss inequality in education and focus on armed guards over the quality of education provided. There is something fundamentally wrong with that viewpoint. The wild west is not a model for our schools. You are not willing to invest in schools, teachers, computers, head start, mental health, STEM labs or anything else that will improve our society. But a bunch of armed guards? Gotta have that. A war on drugs? Gotta have that. A military twice the size of the rest of the worlds? Gotta have that. A giant prison population? Gotta have that. It is reflective of everything that is wrong with your way of thinking. Get the guns off the streets. Stop the shooting. Stop the killing. That is a better society. Not turning our classrooms into the OK Corral.

Topic.Title: Ricky

Message.Msg: The 40 years the Democrats ruled Congress? You mean from 1955 to 1995? Winholder, Federal spending as a proportion of GDP was pretty stable until Reagan took office, when it began to grow and deficit spending became the norm. It declined again under Bush I & Clinton, who insisted on closing the deficit by paying for our spending. Spending began to grow as a percentage of GDP under Bush II and a Republican Congress--who again financed this spending through debt instead of taxes. Borrowing and spending leads to higher spending overall. When deficit spending is the norm spending goes up no matter who controls what branch of government. Spending moderates when their is a commitment to paying as you go. Pay for your stuff as you go and you will have less spending overall. The idea that we should shrink government by deficit spending the country into bankruptcy is insane. This is why I mock you. You deserve it. You should be used to it by now, as I'm sure I'm not the only one who mocks you. If anything, I do not mock you enough, and should redouble my efforts.
